On Mon, Jul 20, 2009 at 10:53 AM, cant_jim<jimcant@...> wrote:
> Thanks=
 for the idea; looks like System.setOut() will do just what I want.
>
> But=
 your answer raises another question; why do I have to 'reset' the Printstr=
eam for each test; I thought all the tests were independent and that there =
wouldn't be leftover state from prior test to confund a later test.

Your c=
urrent object is discarded, and a new one created--static state
and system =
state you have to reset yourself.

> Could this be related to a problem I h=
ad with the test suite with several similar test that wrote to a file: the =
output file of th 2nd tests contained the output of the 1st and 2nd test, t=
he ouput of the 3rd contained the output of the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd tests. =
=A0I ended up having to write separate classes to get all the tests done.

=
In 4.7, you can use TempFolder to flag files that you'd like JUnit to
delet=
e for you, but JUnit does not attempt the general case of
resetting arbitra=
ry filesystem state between tests.

   David Saff
